question: A kite in the shape of a square with a diagonal 32 cm attached to an equilateral triangle of the base 8 cm. Approximately how much paper has been used to make it?
explanation:
Area of paper = Area of square + Area of equilateral triangle
$latex = \\frac{1}{2}(diagonal)^{2} + \\frac{\\sqrt{3}}{4}\\times (side)^{2}&s=1$ 
$latex = \\frac{1}{2}\\times 32 \\times 32 + \\frac{\\sqrt{3}}{4}\\times8 \\times 8&s=1$
$latex = 512 + 16 \\times 1.732$
$latex = 512 +27.712 = 539.712 cm^{2}$ [âˆ´ Diagonal of a square = $latex \\sqrt{2} \\times side$]
Hence option [D] is the right answer.
